It was first created during RÃ¡kosi MÃ¡tyÃ¡s's rule in order to celebrate Liberation Day on April 4 when the Soviet Red Army drove the Nazis away from Hungarian territory in 1950.Cavendish, Marshall (2005), p. 114.https://books.google.com/books?id=2Cw- AAAAMAAJ&dq;=hungarian+liberation+day&pg;=RA6-PA56 Socialist Hungary Marches from Progress to Progress. Chorus: ğ„† Let us sing about Liberation Day, Overjoyed, we are now freeâ€”hooray! Let our throats cleave the air as we all clamour, For the name of our liberator! ğ„‡ Cannons roared and artillery shrieked, Pierced our ground and our souls piqued. Yet the Soviets saved us from harm's way, And now hatred has faded away. ChorusThe Liberation Song. Hosted by Lyrics Translate.
